info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 08 at 6:21AM EDT by NWS Jacksonville
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT SOUTHEASTERN PIERCE...CENTRAL BRANTLEY...CENTRAL WARE...EAST CENTRAL CLINCH AND NORTHWESTERN CHARLTON COUNTIES THROUGH 700 AM EDT... At 621 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms near Braganza, or 8 miles southeast of Waycross, moving northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts around 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Waycross, Blackshear, Nahunta, Patterson, Stephen Foster State Park, Hickox, Boggy Bay, Braganza, Raybon, and Race Pond. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
